Lafave, who had been convicted of having sexual relations with a 14-year-old student, had been on probation, which forbade her from having any contact with anyone under 18. However, she violated this term by having contact with a young male, which the judge found unacceptable.

Although Lafave's lawyers had pleaded with the judge to spare her jail time, the judge did not find their argument compelling. However, they were able to convince him to not sentence her to jail time and instead issued a warning.

The judge warned Lafave to strictly adhere to the terms of her probation and to not come back to court with a similar violation. He also emphasized that her misconduct may lead to a steeper punishment in the future.

Lafave's case had previously gained national attention in 2005, when the allegations against her first surfaced. She had initially been charged with multiple counts of lewd and lascivious behavior but was able to secure a plea deal that included three years' house arrest and seven years' probation.

Lafave's most recent violation is a wake-up call, reminding her of the severity of her actions and the importance of complying with the terms of her probation. However, as the judge warned, any future violations of her probation will not be taken lightly.

Summary: Ralph Lauren began as tie salesman from the Bronx. First design: Wide ties when others were narrow. Has designed high fashion for four decades. Goal: Glamorous clothing that is "consistent and accessible" Article: Ralph Lauren: From Tie Salesman to High Fashion Designer 

Ralph Lauren, one of the biggest names in fashion, started his career as a tie salesman from the Bronx. Little did he know that his keen eye for fashion would turn him into a household name in the world of high fashion. 

Lauren's first design revolutionized the tie industry when he designed wide ties while the trend was narrow ties. This led to the birth of his brand, which has been providing high-quality fashion for over four decades. 

Throughout his career, Ralph Lauren has designed clothing for every occasion from business to casual to sports to evening wear. He has become known for his ability to create glamorous clothing that is 'consistent and accessible,' which has earned him a reputation as one of the best designers of all time. 

Lauren's brand expanded from ties to a full range of products including clothing, accessories, and home decor. His designs have become synonymous with luxury and elegance. From Hollywood to Washington D.C. to Buckingham Palace, Ralph Lauren has dressed everyone from celebrities, politicians, and royalty. 

Lauren's success story has inspired many aspiring designers to follow their passion and create something unique. His legacy will undoubtedly continue to inspire many generations to come. Ralph Lauren's story is a testament to the power of hard work, determination, and perseverance.

Summary: Tip leads police to John Lewis at homeless shelter in Miami. Lewis is suspected in fatal shooting of Philadelphia Ofc. Charles Cassidy. Cassidy walked in on doughnut shop robbery last week and was shot, police say. Philadelphia police alerted Miami counterparts that Lewis was headed that way. Article: Miami, FL - John Lewis, the suspect in the fatal shooting of Philadelphia Police Officer Charles Cassidy, has been located and apprehended at a homeless shelter in Miami. The police in Philadelphia had received a tip that Lewis was headed towards Miami and had alerted their Miami counterparts.

Officer Cassidy was shot after he walked in on a robbery in a doughnut shop in Philadelphia last week. The suspect fled the scene, and police were on the hunt for him ever since. The tragic incident had sparked an intense manhunt for the shooter.

After receiving the tip about John Lewis heading towards Miami, the police had immediately informed the Miami police department about the same. The Miami police then began their investigation and finally found the suspect at a homeless shelter in Miami.

The authorities took John Lewis into their custody without any resistance. He will now be taken back to Philadelphia, where he will be facing charges of murder and robbery.

The Philadelphia police department has extended its gratitude to the Miami PD for their swift assistance in the matter. They have also thanked the person who provided the crucial tip that led to the arrest of the suspect. Officer Charles Cassidy's family has also thanked the police department for their relentless efforts in bringing the suspect to justice.

The tragic shooting of Officer Cassidy has left the Philadelphia community in shock. The police department hopes that with the arrest of the suspect, justice will be served, and the deceased officer's family can find some solace.

Summary: Tiburon is low-slung sportster that won't bust first-time buyer's wallet. Pontiac G5 GT boasts highly sprung motoring. Toyota's hipster Scion comes dripping with gadgetry inside. Article: The latest auto reviews are in, and it looks like car enthusiasts are in for a treat. The Tiburon by Hyundai is receiving rave reviews for its low-slung sportster design that won't break the bank for first-time buyers. It's the perfect car for those looking for a fun ride without emptying out their wallets.

For those who value power and performance, the Pontiac G5 GT is a must-have. With its highly sprung motoring system, you won't find any other car that offers as smooth a ride as this one.

And for tech-savvy drivers, the Toyota Scion takes the cake. This hipster vehicle comes with top-of-the-line gadgetry that any tech-savvy driver would appreciate. From its advanced infotainment system to its wide range of safety features, the Toyota Scion is undoubtedly one of the most technologically advanced cars on the market.

If you're in the market for a new car, you won't find better options than the Tiburon, the Pontiac G5 GT, and the Toyota Scion. Each car has its unique selling points, which will appeal to a range of drivers.

Summary: Bush: Senate "wasting valuable time" with children's health insurance bill. Congress "holding hostage" funds for troops, Bush says. Bush accuses Congress of gridlock, failing to promote anyone's agenda. Democrats fire back, saying Bush's words "ring hollow" Article: President George W. Bush criticized the Senate for "wasting valuable time" with the Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act. The president accused the Congress of "holding hostage" funds for troops, stating that the Senate's focus should be on a spending bill rather than healthcare legislation. Bush contended that the Democrats' "obsession" with the SCHIP bill overrode the more pressing matter of troop funding. 

The president accused Congress of gridlock and failing to promote anyone's agenda. The Democrats were quick to fire back, calling the Bush administration's statements "ring hollow." Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid commented on the president's "lack of leadership" and "muddied message," suggesting that Bush should instead focus on a bipartisan solution to funding the troops rather than attacking the Democrats. 

The SCHIP reauthorization has been a contentious issue between Republicans and Democrats since its initial proposal. The program provides healthcare to low-income families with children and has received significant bipartisan support in the past. However, the divide between Democrats and Republicans has grown, with Democrats proposing a significant increase in funding while Republicans are advocating for a more conservative approach. 

The current SCHIP program expired on September 30th, leaving many families without coverage. Congress has yet to agree on a new funding plan, and the program's future remains uncertain. The fight over SCHIP, combined with the lack of progress on troop funding, has further fueled tensions between the two parties. 

As the 2008 presidential election approaches, both sides are digging in, with each party accusing the other of playing politics with the issues. With the SCHIP bill and troop funding still unresolved, it remains to be seen how Congress and the president will come to a consensus.

Summary: Social worker says sniper Lee Boyd Malvo is a changed person. Ten people were killed in Washington-area sniper attacks in 2002. In a letter to CNN, Malvo writes he's still "grappling with shame, guilt, remorse" Article: Sniper Lee Boyd Malvo, responsible for the death of ten people in Washington D.C. in 2002, is now a changed person, according to a social worker who has been working with him. The social worker, whose name has not been revealed, reported that Malvo has expressed remorse for his actions and is actively working to turn his life around. 

Recently, Malvo wrote a letter to CNN, stating that he is still "grappling with shame, guilt, and remorse." In the letter, Malvo expressed his regret for the harm he had caused and extended his apologies to the families of the victims. 

During the shooting spree in 2002, Malvo, then 17 years old, and his accomplice, John Allen Muhammad, killed ten people and injured three others in a series of random shootings that terrorized the Washington D.C. area for weeks. Muhammad was executed in 2009, while Malvo, then 22 years old, was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole. 

However, since his incarceration, Malvo has undergone a significant transformation, as he has been taking responsibility for his actions and seeking redemption. According to his social worker, Malvo has participated in various programs and has been working to educate young people about the dangers of violence. 

While some may question the sincerity of his transformation, the social worker believes that Malvo's remorse is genuine and that he is making genuine efforts to change. As of now, Malvo remains in prison in Virginia, but his case is likely to spark debate on the possibility of rehabilitation for those who have committed heinous crimes.

Summary: Striker Cristiano Lucarelli keeps his place in Italy's squad to face Scotland. Lucarelli impressed by scoring twice in the recent victory over South Africa. Juventus striker Raffaele Palladino earns his first call-up to the senior squad. Article: Italian striker Cristiano Lucarelli has retained his position in the national squad that will take on Scotland. This news comes after his commendable performance in Italy's recent victory over South Africa, in which he scored two vital goals. 

Lucarelli's impressive performance was not the only highlight of the squad announcement. Up and coming Juventus striker Raffaele Palladino has also received his first call-up to the senior Italian squad, which is a huge achievement for the young player. 

It is expected that new call-up Palladino will use this opportunity to prove himself on the international stage and potentially cement his position in the squad. Meanwhile, Lucarelli will undoubtedly be looking to build on his recent form and help his team secure another victory against Scotland. 

Italy is currently preparing for the World Cup, and the matches against Scotland could prove to be crucial in their build-up to the tournament. The Italian team will face Scotland twice during this international break, first in a friendly match on March 25th and then in a World Cup qualifying match on March 28th. 

Overall, the inclusion of Lucarelli and the introduction of Palladino are positive signs for the Italian team as they look to maintain their impressive form. Fans will be eagerly anticipating the upcoming matches against Scotland to see the new additions in action.

Summary: Erik Prince, CEO of Blackwater USA, testifies before House panel. Hearings held amid an FBI probe into a shootout involving Blackwater personnel. Prince: "I believe we acted appropriately at all times" Article: Erik Prince, the CEO of Blackwater USA, testified before a House panel on Wednesday, amidst an FBI investigation into a recent shootout involving Blackwater personnel. During his testimony, Prince maintained that his company had acted appropriately at all times.

The hearing was packed with lawmakers eager to hear from Prince and to question him about the infamous incident that occurred in Iraq earlier this year. In that incident, Blackwater employees were accused of killing several Iraqi civilians in a shootout that erupted while they were responding to an attack on a convoy.

During his testimony, Prince sought to reassure lawmakers that his company had done nothing wrong in Iraq and had acted appropriately under difficult circumstances. "I believe we acted appropriately at all times," Prince told the panel.

Prince also answered questions about his company's overall role in Iraq and about the training and supervision of its employees. He emphasized that Blackwater had been asked to perform a difficult and risky task in Iraq and had done so with professionalism and dedication. "We take our responsibilities very seriously," Prince said.

The hearing concluded without any major developments or revelations, but it did provide a venue for lawmakers to express their concerns about the role of private security companies in Iraq and the need for greater oversight and accountability. Many lawmakers expressed sympathy for the difficult conditions under which Blackwater operated, but also stressed the importance of ensuring that such companies are held to high standards of conduct and ethics.

Summary: UEFA has punished Benfica midfielder Augustin Binya with a six-match ban. The Cameroon international was sent off for bad tackle on Celtic's Scott Brown. Brown was lucky to escape injury in incident during Champions League match. Article: Benfica midfielder Augustin Binya has been handed a six-match ban by UEFA following his bad tackle on Celtic's Scott Brown. The incident took place during a Champions League match, where Binya was sent off for his actions.

Although Brown was fortunate enough to avoid any serious injuries, the severity of the tackle was enough to spark major controversy. UEFA acted swiftly and decisively in punishing the Cameroonian international, and this ban serves as a warning to others that such behavior will not be tolerated.

The news comes as a blow to Benfica and their fans, who now must navigate a long stretch of the season without one of their key players. However, it also sends a clear message that malicious and reckless tackles have no place in the sport.

UEFA takes player safety seriously and will continue to impose strict penalties on those who endanger their opponents. In light of this incident, both teams will be reminded of the importance of sportsmanship and fair play in the beautiful game.

Summary: Sen. Clinton supported by 44 percent of Democrats polled, down from October. Rudy Giuliani continues to lead Republican presidential field with 28 percent. Clinton beats Giuliani 51 percent to 45 percent, the poll found. Only 42 percent think things are going well in the U.S., according to the poll. Article: In the latest poll results, it appears that Senator Hillary Clinton's support among Democrats has decreased slightly from October. The poll shows that 44 percent of Democrats surveyed support Clinton, down from her previously reported figures. 

Meanwhile, Rudy Giuliani, the former mayor of New York City, continues to lead the Republican presidential field with 28 percent of those polled indicating their support for him. However, when matched against Clinton, the poll found that she still beats Giuliani with 51 percent of the vote, compared to his 45 percent.

Despite the ongoing political battles, it seems that the American public is feeling a little less optimistic. The same poll found that only 42 percent of Americans believe that things are going well in the country currently.

These poll results are the latest in a series of ups and downs as both parties gear up for the crucial 2008 election. With such close margins and shifting support, it remains to be seen how the presidential race will shape up over the coming months.

Summary: Russian President Putin backs Iran's "peaceful" nuclear program during visit. Putin in Tehran to attend summit of Caspian Sea nations to discuss oil rights. Iran, Russia set to discuss Iranian nuclear program, U.S. push for sanctions. Putin downplay rumors of assassination plot; Iran says claims are "baseless" Article: Russian President Vladimir Putin voiced his support for Iran's "peaceful" nuclear program during his visit to Tehran for the Caspian Sea nations summit on Sunday. Putin's visit comes at a critical time as the two nations are set to discuss Iran's nuclear program and the U.S.'s push for sanctions.

During a press conference in Tehran, Putin downplayed rumors of an assassination plot against him, stating that he believes such claims are baseless and meant to undermine the strong ties between Russia and Iran.

The summit, which is being held to discuss oil rights in the Caspian Sea, has also become a platform for Iran and Russia to reaffirm their partnership amid growing pressure from Western nations. Iran has been subject to stiff sanctions from the U.S. and Europe due to its nuclear program, which the West claims is aimed at building nuclear weapons. Iran denies the allegations and says its nuclear program is peaceful.

Putin's visit to Tehran has come as a relief for Iran as it has helped to support the nation against increasing pressure and isolation from the West. Putin's support for Iran's nuclear program is a crucial development, as it may discourage the U.S. from pushing for further sanctions.

Overall, Putin's visit has been critical in strengthening ties between Russia and Iran, which both countries have deemed as essential to their national security. The visit has also helped to ease tensions amid rumors of an assassination plot and growing Western pressure on Iran's nuclear program.

Summary: French president returns to France with three released journalists. Journalists are among seven Europeans freed Sunday in child "kidnap" row. There are still 14 other people in custody in Chad. Father: "They never said they would take away our children" Article: French President Emmanuel Macron has returned to France with three journalists who were among seven Europeans released on Sunday, after being detained in Chad in connection to a child "kidnap" case. The group had been accused of trying to illegally transport 103 children to Europe, but it later emerged that many of the children were not orphans as previously thought.  

The three journalists, who work for French news organization L'Oeil du Sud, were detained for several days along with two Spanish pilots and a Belgian and Egyptian national. All of them had been involved in the case in some capacity. Following their release, the journalists expressed relief at being free and thanked Macron and the French government for their support.  

However, the release of the journalists has also highlighted the ongoing detention of 14 others, who are still being held in Chad. These individuals were also believed to be involved in the alleged child trafficking operation, and include both Europeans and Chadians. Their families have expressed concern over their continued detention, with one father insisting that "they never said they would take away our children".  

The case has sparked international attention and controversy, with some questioning the actions of the French and Chadian governments in response to the crisis. Macron has defended his government's intervention, insisting that they have been "working tirelessly" to resolve the situation. Meanwhile, advocates for children's rights have called for greater scrutiny of orphanages and child welfare programs in Chad, where poverty and conflict have put many vulnerable children at risk.

Summary: Four killed in crash; two people die later of injuries. Copter took off from Aviano Air Base, news agency reports. Black Hawk helicopter had 11 people aboard. Article: AVIANO AIR BASE, Italy - A tragic incident unfolded on Monday evening as a Black Hawk helicopter operated by the U.S. Army crashed shortly after taking off from Aviano Air Base in northeastern Italy. The helicopter, which was carrying eleven people aboard, crashed in a wooded area near the base. 

According to a report by a local news agency, four people were killed in the initial crash. Two others who survived the crash died later of their injuries. The remaining five passengers were injured and have been transported to a local hospital for medical care. 

The identities of the victims have not yet been released by the military. However, officials have stated that the victims were all U.S. service members. 

The cause of the crash is still unclear, and an investigation is currently underway. 

"Our thoughts and prayers are with the families and loved ones of the soldiers who lost their lives in this tragic incident," said U.S. Army Europe and Africa on Twitter. 

The Black Hawk helicopter is a U.S. Army utility helicopter that is often used for transporting troops and supplies. It is also used for medical evacuation missions and during disaster response efforts. 

The crash has sent shockwaves across the military community, both locally and internationally. The U.S. Army has promised to release further information as it becomes available.

Summary: University of Memphis athlete Taylor Bradford, 21, was shot September 30. Three charged with murder in perpetration of attempted aggravated robbery. After player was shot, he got in his car, drove off and then crashed into a tree. The killing spurred school officials to temporarily lock down the campus. Article: On the evening of September 30th, tragedy struck the University of Memphis community as 21-year-old athlete Taylor Bradford was shot and killed in an attempted robbery. The incident occurred near campus, as Bradford was getting out of his car. Three individuals have been charged with murder in connection to the incident.

After being shot, Bradford got back into his car and attempted to drive away. However, in his haste to escape, he crashed into a nearby tree. Sadly, he did not survive the ordeal.

The news of Bradford's death sent shockwaves throughout the university and the greater Memphis community. School officials responded by temporarily locking down the campus in an effort to ensure the safety of students and staff.

Bradford was a beloved member of the university's athletic community, and his passing has left many mourning his loss. The university has expressed its condolences to his family and friends, and is offering support to those who may be struggling in the wake of this tragedy.

As the investigation into the incident continues, many are left wondering how such a senseless act of violence could occur. The university is working closely with local law enforcement agencies to gather more information on the incident and ensure justice is served.

Summary: Kevin Federline to take custody of children effective Wednesday noon. Federline and Britney Spears have two children, ages 2 and 1. Pair were divorced in July. Article: In a new development, Kevin Federline is set to take custody of his two children with ex-wife Britney Spears effective Wednesday noon. This news follows months of legal battles between Federline and Spears, who were divorced in July. 
The former couple share two children, ages 2 and 1, and until now, Spears had primary custody of the kids. However, a judge has now granted Federline the right to take over as custodial parent. The exact reasons for this decision have not been made public. 
This comes as a surprise to many, as Spears has been very vocal about her love for her children on social media. However, it seems that the legal system has decided that Federline is the better choice for their care going forward. 
Fans of Spears and Federline will undoubtedly be following this news closely and eagerly awaiting further updates.

Summary: Judge doubles bail to $250,000, accuses of "arrogance" or "ignorance" Jailed since Friday, Simpson was required to put down $37,500 in cash to get out. Bail bondsman tells judge O.J. Simpson never paid him. DA says Simpson violated bail terms by leaving message for co-defendant. Article: Former football star O.J. Simpson has had his bail doubled to $250,000 by a judge in Nevada, after the accused was accused of either "arrogance" or "ignorance". Simpson had already put down $37,500 in cash to get out, but the judge has now demanded a total of $250,000 for his release. The reason for the increased bail amount is due to Simpson's failure to cooperate with the bail bondsman who helped him post his original bail.

The District Attorney announced that Simpson had violated the terms of his previous bail by leaving a message for his co-defendant in the alleged armed robbery case, which led to his arrest back in 2007. The judge went on to say that Simpson's actions were not the result of ignorance but rather arrogance, as he had been warned previously not to contact his co-defendant.

Simpson has been in jail since Friday, despite having previously posted bail. The increased amount for the bail is expected to keep him in custody, at least until a new bail hearing is held. This latest setback for Simpson comes as he is awaiting trial on charges of armed robbery, conspiracy, and kidnapping.

Summary: F-15s grounded after a November 1 crash in Missouri. F-15 is used for ground support in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. All U.S. Air Force 224 E-model aircraft will undergo a one-time inspection. Article: The United States Air Force has grounded all F-15s after a crash that occurred on November 1 in Missouri. The F-15 is a fighter jet that has been in service since the 1970s and is used for ground support in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Following the crash, the Air Force has announced that all 224 E-model F-15s will undergo a one-time inspection. The aim of the inspection is to determine if there are any safety concerns with the aircraft that may compromise their functionality in the warfront.

The F-15s are important assets in the fight against terrorism, and their temporary grounding will likely impact military operations in the Middle East. However, the Air Force has assured the public that swift measures are being taken to ensure the planes are fit for purpose and will return to service as soon as possible.

The cause of the November 1 crash is currently under investigation. However, the Air Force is taking steps to prevent any further incidents and has made the safety of its pilots and crew a top priority.

This temporary grounding of the F-15s demonstrates the importance of safety in the military and shows the level of scrutiny that is placed on crucial equipment to prevent the loss of lives in the line of duty.

Summary: Detainees file suit against ICE, allege they were injected with drugs. One detainee tells CNN: "What they did to me was very, very bad" ICE says 1,073 detainees have had "medical escorts" since 2003. Sen. Lieberman vows to investigate further; spokesman calls charges "troubling" Article: In a shocking allegation, a group of detainees has filed a lawsuit against US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and alleged that they were injected with drugs without their consent. The detainees claim they were forcibly injected with psychotropic drugs while being held at the Irwin County Detention Center in Georgia.

One of the detainees, who spoke to CNN on condition of anonymity, said, "What they did to me was very, very bad. I didn't know what was happening to me." Other detainees also reported similar experiences.

ICE, in response to the allegations, stated that over 1,073 detainees have had "medical escorts" since 2003. However, they did not comment on the specific allegations of forced injections.

The lawsuit has caught the attention of lawmakers, with Senator Joe Lieberman vowing to investigate the matter further. A spokesperson for Lieberman called the charges "troubling" and emphasized the need for a thorough investigation.

The allegations against ICE are the latest controversy to emerge from the US migrant detention system. Over the years, human rights groups have called for an end to the inhumane treatment of migrants held in detention across the country.

As the investigation into the drug injection allegations unfolds, advocates for migrants' rights will be closely watching to see if the detainees receive justice and if reforms are implemented to prevent similar incidents in the future.

Summary: Mom thinks girl was abused while in the care of a baby sitter, attorney says. Mother had no idea daughter had been abused, attorney says. Girl, now 7, shown being raped on videotape made years ago. Manhunt underway for suspect, Chester Arthur Stiles, 37. Article: In a shocking development in the Las Vegas area, a mother has raised suspicion of abuse while her child was under the care of a baby sitter. According to her attorney, the mother had no idea that her daughter had suffered abuse while under the care of the sitter.

The alleged abuse came to light when a videotape was discovered that showed the 7-year-old girl being raped. The video was made years ago and authorities have launched a manhunt for the suspect, identified as 37-year-old Chester Arthur Stiles.

The mother's attorney has revealed that she is devastated by the news and is struggling to come to grips with the fact that her daughter suffered such heinous abuse. The attorney further stated that the mother had taken all the necessary precautions while choosing a baby sitter for her child.

The discovery of the video has sent shockwaves across the community and has once again highlighted the need for parents to be extra cautious while selecting a caregiver for their children.

The police department has urged anyone with any information on the whereabouts of Chester Arthur Stiles to come forward and share it with the authorities. Meanwhile, the mother and her family are grappling with the aftermath of this terrible incident, hoping to one day heal from the emotional scars left behind by the abuse.

Summary: Sen. Hillary Clinton defends vote on resolution, saying "it's not a law" Sen. Barack Obama: President could use Iran measure to justify military action. Obama says Clinton's vote for resolution shows "flawed" judgment. Differences with Clinton will be clear in "next phase" of campaign, Obama says. Article: Washington D.C. – Sen. Hillary Clinton is defending her vote on the recent Senate resolution regarding Iran, stating that it shouldn't be seen as a law. Meanwhile, her opponent in the Democratic presidential nomination race, Sen. Barack Obama, has criticized the resolution, stating that the president could potentially use it as a basis for military action against Iran.

Obama has been particularly critical of Clinton's vote, claiming that it shows "flawed" judgment. The two candidates have been engaged in a heated debate over the issue in recent weeks, with Obama also taking issue with Clinton's past votes in favor of the Iraq War.

As the campaign enters its next phase, Obama has vowed to continue highlighting the differences between himself and Clinton on foreign policy issues. He has argued that his approach to diplomacy would be more effective than Clinton's, stating that his willingness to engage in dialogue with countries like Iran would prevent the need for military action.

Clinton, on the other hand, has argued that her vote on the resolution was a necessary step in holding Iran accountable for its actions. She has also expressed support for diplomatic efforts, but has stopped short of advocating for direct talks with Iran.

As the campaign heads towards the primaries, it remains to be seen how much of an impact the debate over Iran will have on the race. However, it's clear that the issue has become a major point of contention for the two candidates.

Summary: Charges against Bryant Purvis reduced to second degree aggravated battery. Purvis had faced attempted murder, conspiracy charges. Charges reduced against at least five of six blacks charged in beating. Case of "Jena 6" drew national spotlight during September protest. Article: The case of the "Jena 6" has drawn national attention, but recently, charges against at least five of the six black teens involved in the beating of a white student have been reduced. The charges against Bryant Purvis, one of the teenagers charged, have been reduced from attempted murder and conspiracy, to second degree aggravated battery. 

The incident occurred in Louisiana in 2006 and sparked protests across the country as many saw the charges against the black teens as an example of unfair treatment by the criminal justice system. The case drew the attention of high profile figures like Reverend Jesse Jackson, who called for the charges against the teenagers to be dropped. 

After the charges were reduced, some have said that the defendants have been vindicated. However, critics argue that the charges should never have been brought against the teenagers in the first place and that the criminal justice system needs to be reformed to prevent similar situations from occurring in the future.

The Jena 6 case has become a symbol of racial inequality and injustice. While the reduced charges may be seen as some progress, the case serves as a reminder of the work that still needs to be done to ensure that all people, regardless of race, receive fair treatment under the law.

Summary: T.I. to remain in custody until Friday, when there's a bond hearing. Rapper was arrested Saturday on weapons charges. T.I. won two awards at BET awards show Saturday night. Article: Grammy-winning rapper T.I., whose real name is Clifford Harris Jr., will remain in custody until Friday when there will be a bond hearing. He was arrested on Saturday on charges of possession of unregistered firearms. The rapper was taken into custody just hours before he was slated to take the stage at the BET awards show where he won two awards. T.I. has not yet been charged and it is unclear if he has legal representation at this time. Fans of the rapper expressed their disappointment over social media, many hoping for his release soon. T.I. has had previous run-ins with the law, including a stint in federal prison in 2009. His most recent arrest has left his fans and the music industry questioning his future. More information is expected to be released after his bond hearing later this week.

Summary: Authorities call it one of the largest counterfeit operations ever discovered. Official: Scheme profited "off the backs of legitimate companies" Counterfeit operation allegedly involved 300,000 high-end bags and wallets. The alleged leaders are three Chinese citizens living in New York. Article: NEW YORK - Authorities in New York have uncovered what is being called one of the largest counterfeit operations ever discovered, allegedly involving 300,000 high-end bags and wallets. The alleged leaders of the scheme are three Chinese citizens living in New York. 

"This operation profited off the backs of legitimate companies and their hard-working employees," said an official familiar with the investigation, who requested anonymity. "This kind of illegal activity damages our economy and affects jobs in industries ranging from manufacturing to retail."

The operation was discovered after a tip-off led to a raid on several properties in New York City. The fake bags and wallets were found at one location, along with high-tech equipment used to make them. The alleged leaders were taken into custody and face multiple charges including trademark counterfeiting and criminal possession of a forged instrument.

The authorities stressed that counterfeiting not only harms the companies whose products are being copied, but also poses a potential danger to consumers as the products do not undergo the same safety and quality checks as genuine items.

"This is a significant victory against counterfeiters and serves as a warning to anyone engaged in this kind of illegal activity," the official said. "We will continue to work with our law enforcement partners to root out these criminal enterprises and protect the public and legitimate businesses."

Summary: National Hurricane Center director Bill Proenza has left his position. Nearly half of the NHC signed a petition calling for him to step down. Proenza came under fire for comments he made about the QuikSCAT satellite. Staff unhappy with environment of closed doors, public bickering. Article: National Hurricane Center Director Bill Proenza has resigned from his position following significant pressure from staff. Almost half of the center had signed a petition calling for his leadership to come to an end. Proenza had come under fire for his comments about the QuikSCAT satellite which led many staff members to lose confidence in his leadership. Furthermore, there have been complaints about the closed environment and public bickering that characterized the workplace under Proenza’s administration.

The controversy stems from Proenza’s increasingly vitriolic criticism of the QuikSCAT satellite. He claimed that the “aging” satellite was essential for forecasting the hurricane path and that its failure could put lives at risk. However, many experts have come out against Proenza’s argument, stating that the center has alternate means of gathering information that could be used if QuikSCAT stopped working. Misinformation around the satellite and Proenza’s criticism is what sparked the anger of many staff members who ultimately signed the petition calling for his resignation.

Proenza was appointed Director in January 2017 and has been widely criticized throughout his tenure for his administration style. Many staff members have complained about the level of secrecy and hostility that characterized the workplace under his leadership. The administrator at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, the organization responsible for the National Hurricane Center, has praised the hard work and dedication of staff members and thanked them for the difficult decision they've made.

The immediate future of the National Hurricane Center is unclear. There have been rumors that an interim director will be named, but the office of the NOAA has yet to announce any official news. What is clear is that there is a team of dedicated staff members who are passionate about forecasting and ensuring the safety of the US coastline. As they work to overcome this challenge, they will no doubt continue to put their motto in motion, which is to “pre-warn, post-storm.”

Summary: More than 1,700 people dead, toll expected to rise, official says. 15,000 people are injured following Thursday's tropical Cyclone Sidr. U.N. World Food Programme has food for 400,000 people for three days. Power outages, massive traffic jams and poor phone service in Dhaka. Article: The devastating effects of Cyclone Sidr continue to unfold in Bangladesh, as the death toll climbs above 1,700 with many more feared dead. The powerful storm struck the country on Thursday, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. Over 15,000 people have been injured in the disaster, and the toll is expected to rise as rescue workers continue to scour the affected areas.

The U.N. World Food Programme has already mobilized to provide relief to the affected communities, with enough food supplies for 400,000 people for three days. However, the logistics of distributing aid remain complicated by the widespread power outages, massive traffic jams, and poor phone services in the capital city of Dhaka.

The scale of the disaster has overwhelmed local officials, with rescue workers struggling to reach many of the remote and flooded areas. Thousands of homes have been destroyed, leaving countless families without shelter, while infrastructure damage has disrupted supply chains for relief efforts. International aid agencies and governments are now mobilizing to provide additional support.

The situation remains critical, and emergency responders are working around the clock to provide aid and support to those affected by Cyclone Sidr. The full extent of the damage is yet to be determined, but Bangladesh will require significant help to recover from this disaster and rebuild its devastated communities.

Summary: Louisiana resident, 18, faces federal hate-crime, conspiracy charges. Driver allegedly taunted civil rights marchers with nooses on pickup truck. Marchers were protesting handling of several racially charged incidents. Article: In a disturbing display of hatred, an 18-year-old Louisiana resident has been charged with federal hate-crime and conspiracy charges. The driver, whose identity has not been released, taunted civil rights marchers with nooses tied to their pickup truck as they protested the handling of several racially charged incidents. 

The incident took place in the heart of Louisiana as marchers engaged in a peaceful protest against the treatment of minority communities amid the rise of racially motivated hate crimes. The driver's actions not only insulted the protestors directly, but also contributed to an already hostile and racially charged environment. 

"The use of a noose, an undeniable symbol of racial violence and intimidation, to threaten and intimidate individuals engaged in peaceful protest is a serious crime," said a spokesperson for the Attorney General's office. 

The alleged act of hate and violence is a wake-up call for communities across the nation. It is a stark reminder of the need for unconditional support of the laws that protect minority groups and the need for strict legislative action against hate crimes. The situation highlights the necessity of peaceful and cohesive social change through dialogue and not violence. 

This incident underscores the importance of vigilant and compassionate communities taking action to prevent hate crimes. It is imperative that officials be especially vigilant in protecting minority communities as they stand up for their rights and demand the respect they deserve. 

The perpetrator has been charged with a federal hate crime offense, conspiracy, and faces serious legal consequences for their actions. The case highlights the need for continued education about the importance of equality and respect for all, regardless of race, ethnicity, religion or sexual orientation.

Summary: R.E.M. song "Until the Day Is Done" debuts on CNN. Song also to be used in documentary "Planet in Peril" Song will be on R.E.M.'s upcoming album. Band releasing live CD/DVD next week. Article: Alternative rock band R.E.M. has debuted their latest song "Until the Day Is Done" on CNN. The song will also be featured in an upcoming documentary titled "Planet in Peril". The band's newest offering will be a part of their upcoming album, which is sure to excite their passionate fan base.

"Until the Day Is Done" is a politically charged song that addresses environmental issues and social injustices, which fits the theme of the "Planet in Peril" documentary. The track provides a perfect backdrop for the visuals, bringing forth the message of concern for the planet while highlighting the need for change.

In addition to their new album, R.E.M. is also set to release a live CD/DVD next week. The release is a record of their 2007 live performance in Dublin, which was part of their "Accelerate" tour. Fans will get to relive the energy and passion of the band's performance, and experience the magic of their live shows all over again.

R.E.M. has been one of the most iconic bands in the alternative rock genre, with a string of hits in their lengthy career. With their latest song, "Until the Day Is Done," they continue to deliver compelling music that resonates with their fans and addresses contemporary issues.

We can't wait to see what the band has in store for their forthcoming album and look forward to seeing them perform live again soon.

Summary: Government wants land for border fence; landowners refuse. Secretary Chertoff says he won't relent "for a particular individual" Eloisa Tamez says her property has been in her family since 1767. Border town mayor calls the fence "a multibillion-dollar speed bump" Article: The debate over the construction of a border fence is heating up as the government faces resistance from landowners. The government wants to build a fence to secure the border, but many landowners are refusing to give up their land. Secretary Chertoff has made it clear that he will not relent for a particular individual, despite pleas from landowners.

One landowner, Eloisa Tamez, has expressed her concerns about the fence. Her property has been in her family since 1767, and she is not willing to give it up without a fight. Tamez is one of many landowners who see the fence as a threat to their property rights.

The border town mayor has also weighed in on the issue, calling the fence a multibillion-dollar speed bump. He argues that the fence will not be effective in stopping illegal immigration and will only cause more problems for landowners.

The debate over the border fence has been going on for years, but it seems to have reached a boiling point. The government is determined to secure the border, but landowners are equally determined to protect their property. It remains to be seen how the issue will be resolved, but it is clear that both sides are digging in for a fight.

Summary: Christian pastors borrow ideas from Scientology to preach temperate lifestyle. Critics say Scientology is a cult, always looking for recruits. Pastor in Houston, Texas, claims 70 percent success rate with addicts. Article: In a surprising twist, Christian pastors are incorporating ideas borrowed from Scientology to promote a temperate lifestyle. While some are applauding the move, others are voicing concerns that Scientology is, in fact, a cult that is always seeking new recruits.

One pastor in Houston, Texas, claims that this approach has yielded impressive results. In fact, he boasts a success rate of 70% when working with addicts. While the specific techniques that these pastors are using are not clear at this time, it seems that they are drawing inspiration from Scientology's focus on personal responsibility, self-improvement, and the power of positive thinking.

Critics of Scientology argue that the organization is more interested in recruiting new members than truly helping people change their lives. They cite the group's history of controversial practices, such as the use of "auditing" sessions where members are hooked up to a machine to measure their emotional responses to questioning.

Despite these concerns, these pastors are confident that their approach is making a difference in the lives of their congregants. They believe that the key to success is combining the best aspects of a variety of belief systems in order to promote healing and wellness.

Ultimately, only time will tell whether incorporating ideas from Scientology into Christian preaching will become a popular trend or remain a niche approach. For now, however, these pastors seem to be making progress in helping their congregants lead fulfilling and happier lives.

Summary: Vick's September 13 drug test shows marijuana use. Pretrial release conditions tightened; must stay home from 10 p.m. to 6 a.m. Virginia grand jury indicts Vick and the three co-defendants on state charges. Vick already faces up to 18 months in prison after federal plea deal. Article: Football player Michael Vick, who was suspended from the NFL in 2007 for his involvement in a dogfighting ring, is once again making headlines. The athlete recently failed a drug test for marijuana on September 13, 2019. The failed test has led to pretrial release conditions being tightened, as Vick will now be required to stay home from 10 p.m. to 6 a.m. 

In addition to his recent drug test failure, Vick’s legal troubles continue to escalate. A Virginia grand jury recently indicted Vick and his three co-defendants on state charges related to the dogfighting ring he was involved in. These new charges come on top of the 18-month prison sentence Vick could already face, as a result of a previous federal plea deal.

Vick has found himself in hot water before, having faced backlash and legal repercussions for his involvement in the dogfighting ring. It seems as though his legal troubles will not be going away anytime soon, as these new state charges further complicate his situation. Fans and followers continue to track the progress of Vick’s case as he attempts to navigate his legal challenges and put his past mistakes behind him.

Summary: Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr say their music sounds better. The former Beatles talk to CNN's Larry King. Widows of John Lennon and George Harrison also appeared. Harrison, Ono say their husbands still have strong presence. Article: Legendary musicians and former members of The Beatles, Sir Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr, recently discussed how their music still sounds fresh and relevant today in an interview with CNN's iconic talk show host Larry King.

The beloved musicians shared some memorable moments from their time as part of the Fab Four, and how the music they created has stood the test of time. The surviving former Beatles expressed their deep belief that the music they created over half a century ago still has the ability to connect with audiences today.

The widows of former Beatles John Lennon and George Harrison, Yoko Ono and Olivia Harrison, also appeared on the show and shared their insights into their late husbands' music careers. They expressed admiration for McCartney and Starr's continued dedication to keeping The Beatles' music alive and relevant.

Olivia Harrison spoke about how she feels her husband's presence still lingers in the music he created, saying "His music seems to be timeless and still gives so much to so many people, and I feel that's a testament to his spirit."

Yoko Ono echoed the sentiment, saying "John always believed that music was a universal language that could bring people together. His message is still reaching people today, and that's something we can all be proud of."

It is clear that The Beatles' legacy extends far beyond the music they created. Their impact on popular culture is immeasurable, and the continued appreciation of their music by audiences today is a testament to their enduring relevance. McCartney and Starr's dedication to maintaining and preserving The Beatles' legacy ensures that their music will be enjoyed for generations to come.

Summary: U.N. agency appeals for medical resettlement of Palestinians in Iraq camps. About 2,000 Palestinians in camps along Iraq-Syria border. 30 to 40 refugees arrive at border camp each week, UNHCR says. Article: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) has recently made an appeal for the medical resettlement of around 2,000 Palestinians who are currently residing in camps along the Iraq-Syria border. The UNHCR is asking for urgent assistance in order to provide these individuals with the medical care and assistance they need to live healthy and productive lives.

According to the UNHCR, around 30 to 40 refugees are arriving at the border camp every week, which is putting a strain on already limited resources. The organization is working tirelessly to provide aid and support to these refugees, but more help is needed in order to ensure that they receive the medical attention they require.

The Palestinians in these camps have been living in extremely challenging conditions for a long time, having fled their homes due to conflict and violence in their homeland. Many of them have been living in these camps for years, with limited access to basic necessities such as food, water, and medical care.

The UNHCR's plea for medical resettlement comes as a response to the urgent need for medical assistance for these vulnerable refugees. The organization is calling on member countries to step up and provide the financial assistance needed to support the medical resettlement of these refugees.

The UNHCR is committed to providing ongoing support to these refugees, but additional support is needed in order to ensure that they receive the medical care and assistance they deserve. The organization is hoping that its appeal will be heard and that refugees can receive the medical assistance they need as soon as possible.

Summary: Debate will be last time top Democrats face off before Super Tuesday contests. Sens. Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama to go one-on-one for first time together. Ex-Sen. John Edwards suspended presidential campaign Wednesday. Debate will start at 8 ET on Thursday night on CNN and CNN.com. Article: The race for the Democratic presidential nomination is nearing a crucial point, with the Super Tuesday contests just around the corner. And tonight, two of the top candidates will step onto the stage for what will be their final debate before voters head to the polls next week.

Senators Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama will be facing off one-on-one for the first time together, with both candidates looking to gain the upper hand in what has become a tight and closely watched race. With a number of key contests coming up on Super Tuesday, each candidate will be looking to make their case to voters and score some much-needed momentum heading into the next phase of the campaign.

The debate will begin at 8 pm Eastern Time tonight on CNN and CNN.com, and it is sure to be a lively and engaging exchange. Both Clinton and Obama have been sharpening their messages in recent days, and they will no doubt be looking to score points against one another on issues ranging from healthcare to foreign policy.

Also on the minds of many viewers will be the recent announcement by former Senator John Edwards that he was suspending his presidential campaign, leaving the race to just two top contenders. Edwards was seen as a progressive champion by many in the party, and his departure from the race has left a void that Clinton and Obama will be looking to fill in the weeks ahead.

The debate promises to be a high-stakes affair, with the candidates jockeying for position and looking to gain an edge in what has become one of the most competitive primary campaigns in recent memory. Political analysts and voters alike will be closely watching tonight's debate to see which candidate will come out on top and emerge as the frontrunner heading into Super Tuesday.

Summary: The United States is outraged by the attack, Secretary of State Rice says. Car bomb strikes U.S. Embassy vehicle north of Beirut. Three Lebanese civilians dead, American and Lebanese officials confirm. Driver of the vehicle was slightly injured, and the only passenger was not hurt. Article: A deadly car bomb explosion has rocked the U.S. Embassy vehicle in northern Lebanon leaving three Lebanese civilians dead. The attack has triggered outrage and condemnation from U.S. officials who condemned the perpetrators of the heinous act.

According to reports, the bomb exploded while the U.S. Embassy vehicle was traveling on a road near the suburb of Dbayeh. The blast killed the occupants of the other passing cars. It is unclear yet who was behind the attack; however, sources say that the incident appears to be targeted at American interests in the region.

American Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice said that the United States is outraged by the attack. "We condemn in the strongest possible terms the attack on our personnel in Beirut, Lebanon," she said in a statement. "The United States stands ready to help Lebanese authorities in any manner necessary to investigate this heinous crime.”

The driver of the vehicle was slightly injured in the attack, while the only passenger escaped unharmed. Lebanese and American officials have confirmed the deaths of the three civilians and expressed their condolences to their families.

Lebanese authorities have launched an investigation into the attack. It is the first time since 1983 that an explosion has struck a U.S. Embassy vehicle in Beirut, which had been targeted by repeated attacks during Lebanon's civil war.

The U.S. Embassy has requested all its local personnel to remain vigilant and take precautions as the security situation in the country continues to remain fragile. The American government has also urged all American citizens in Beirut to exercise caution and avoid traveling in the area until the situation is brought under control.

Summary: "Rainbow Man," or the John 3:16 guy, is in prison. Communist dictator is a hoops fan. From fan to talk radio host. How an all-star heckler lost his seat. Article: In a surprising turn of events, the iconic "Rainbow Man" or the John 3:16 guy, has found himself behind bars. The man who gained national attention for flashing signs with biblical references during major sporting events, is now in prison. The reasons for his incarceration are not yet known.

Meanwhile, a communist dictator has revealed his surprising love for basketball. The ruler, known for his iron-fisted governance, has recently been seen attending basketball games and even engaging in discussions with players. The news has come as a shock to many who had regarded him as an enemy of all Western values.

On the other hand, a fan's passion for basketball has led him to host his own talk radio show. The man who was once known for his constant heckling during games, has now found a way to channel his enthusiasm and knowledge for the sport. His show has gained a following among avid basketball fans, who enjoy his insightful commentary and analysis.

However, not all fans have been so lucky. One all-star heckler found himself banned from a basketball arena, after his persistent heckling went too far. The man who had been a regular fixture in the stadium for years, had to watch the game from outside for the first time. It is a reminder that while enthusiasm is a good thing, it must be tempered with respect and consideration for others.
